intro: Gironniera subaequalis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false heather, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. Its leaves are narrow and dark green, and it produces white or pinkish flowers in the spring. Gironniera subaequalis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its compact growth habit and attractive appearance.
